RevisionEvent.Note: STEREO SECCHI: Initial SPASE XML resource description submission. Metadata submitted by A. Vourlidas on 2022-02-19, reviewed by LFB

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: The EUVI images (all four wavelengths) are processed via a wavelet-based multi-scale algorithm to remove the zeroth order component (primarily stray light). The algorithm is tuned to enhance the off-limb emission in the images. The resulting images are stored as both FITS (using the original header) and PNGs and can be ingested by the SECCHI Solarsoft IDL routines for analysis
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please note that all of the SECCHI data is free for public use, but if you use them in presentations, published work, websites, etc, please give the appropriate image credits ("STEREO/SECCHI" will usually suffice).

PublicationInfo.Authors: Stenborg, G.A., A. Vourlidas, and R.A. Howard

InformationURL.Name: Algorithm Description
InformationURL.Description: The paper describes the algorithm and its application on the SOHO EIT images but the process is essential identical for the STEREO EUVI images: Stenborg, G., A. Vourlidas, and R.A. Howard, A Fresh View of the Extreme-Ultraviolet Corona from the Application of a New Image-Processing Technique, Astrophys. J., 674(2), 2008. (https://doi.org/10.1086/525556)

Rights.Note: CC0 1.0 Universal is the Creative Commons license applicable to all publicly available NASA Heliophysics data products

TimeSpan.Note: The EUVI files are wavelet-processed as soon as the level 0 files become available, usually within 3 days of acqusition
